refnamediv.refpurpose: An HTTP header that is sent from client to server.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "host" gchar* : Read / Write "if-modified-since" glong : Read / Write "max-forwards" glong : Read / Write "path" gchar* : Read / Write "referrer" gchar* : Read / Write "user-agent" gchar* : Read / Write "verb" EvaHttpVerb : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A request is the first of two messages in an HTTP transaction. It indicates the type of transaction, usually GET or POST, and the desired path, and other assorted flags.

refsect2.title: EvaHttpRequest
refsect2.para: An instance of a HTTP request header.

listitem.simpara: type of request (the intended action).
the location of the resource to affect.
list of character-sets acceptable to the client.
list of content-encodings acceptable to the client.
list of transfer-encodings acceptable to the client.
list of media-types acceptable to the client.
optional authorization information.
optional host header, required principally on machines which do virtual hosting.
whether an If-Match header is present.
unix time or -1 if no such header present.
program or agent making the request.
URL which led us to this resource.
list of cookies.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_add_cookie ()
refsect2.para: Add a Cookie header line to a request.
Cookies are defined in RFC 2965, a draft standard.

[Section 3.3.4] Sending Cookies to the Origin Server. When [the user-agent] sends a request to an origin server, the user agent includes a Cookie request header if it has stored cookies that are applicable to the request, based on (1) the request-host and request-port; (2) the request-URI; (3) the cookie's age.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.
the cookie to add to the request. It will be freed when the request is freed.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_remove_cookie ()
refsect2.para: Remove a cookie from the request's list and delete it.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.
the cookie to remove from the request.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_find_cookie ()
refsect2.para: Find a cookie provided in the request by key.

listitem.simpara: the request to query.
the key field of the cookie to return.
a pointer to the cookie, or NULL if not found.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_add_charsets ()
refsect2.para: Add Accept-CharSet headers to the header. The char-sets will be freed when header is destroyed.
A CharSet is a string representing a Character Set, and an optional real quality factor for that particular Character Set. (The default is 1.0)
The CharSet "*" matches all other Character Sets. If no "*" is given, then it is as though all other character sets were given a quality of 0.0.
If no Accept-CharSet header is given, then all character sets are equally acceptable.

If a server cannot meet character set requirements, it SHOULD response with an error (EVA_HTTP_STATUS_NOT_ACCEPTABLE) but it may also ignore it, and send output in a character-set the client has not suggested.
See RFC 2616, Section 14.2.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.
list of a EvaHttpCharSet's to indicate are accepted.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_clear_charsets ()
refsect2.para: Delete all accepted char-sets from the HTTP request.
This has the effect of leaving a server free to use any character set.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_add_content_encodings ()
refsect2.para: Add Accept-Encoding lines to the header. Each EvaHttpContentEncodingSet represents a single possible encoding and an optional associated quality factor.
The rules for conduct are the same as for character set, with the exception that if no Accept-Encoding line is given then the 'identity' encoding should be preferred.
Note that the EVA http server and client handle content encoding automatically, and will do the correct thing without your intervention.
See RFC 2616, Section 14.3.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_clear_content_encodings ()
refsect2.para: Delete all accepted encodings from the HTTP request.
This has the effect of leaving a server free to use any content encoding.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_add_transfer_encodings ()
refsect2.para: The rules for conduct are the same as for character set, with the exception that the defaults are 'none' for HTTP 1.0 clients, and 'none' and 'chunked' for HTTP 1.1 clients.
Note that the EVA http server and client handle content encoding automatically, and will do the correct thing without your intervention.
This corresponds to the TE: header. See RFC 2616, Section 14.39.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_clear_transfer_encodings ()
refsect2.para: Delete all accepted transfer encodings from the HTTP request.
This has the effect of leaving a server free to use just no encoding for HTTP 1.0 clients and also 'chunked' for HTTP 1.1 clients.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_add_media ()
refsect2.para: Add Accept: headers to the header. The media-type-sets will be freed when header is destroyed.
A MediaSet is a range of media accepted, with quality factors as for eva_http_request_add_charsets().
Note that '*' in a subtype applies to all media with that major type, but if a specific subtype matches, then it's quality is given priority.
XXX: Also, there is an accept-extension 'level='... find out what it does!
See RFC 2616, Section 14.1.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.
list of a EvaHttpMediaTypeSet's to indicate are acceptable.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_clear_media ()
refsect2.para: Delete all accepted media-type-sets from the HTTP request.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_new_blank ()
refsect2.para: Create a new empty HTTP request.

listitem.simpara: the new request.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new simple HTTP request.

listitem.simpara: what type of request to make.
path requested.
the new request.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_set_verb()
refsect2.para: The verb is EVA's name for the type of action being requested. It is the very first word of the HTTP transaction. See EvaHttpVerb for a list.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.
the new HTTP request verb.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_get_verb()
refsect2.para: Get the type of action being requested. See EvaHttpVerb for a list.

listitem.simpara: the request to query.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_peek_from()
refsect2.para: Get the From field, if any, from the HTTP header.

listitem.simpara: the request to query.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_set_from()
refsect2.para: [From RFC 2616, Section 14.22] The From request-header field, if given, SHOULD contain an Internet e-mail address for the human user who controls the requesting user agent. The address SHOULD be machine-usable, as defined by "mailbox" in RFC 822 as updated by RFC 1123.

listitem.simpara: the request to affect.
the email of the user making the request.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_set_if_modified_since()
refsect2.para: [From RFC 2616, Section 14.25] The If-Modified-Since request-header field is used with a method to make it conditional: if the requested variant has not been modified since the time specified in this field, an entity will not be returned from the server; instead, a 304 (not modified) response will be returned without any message-body.

listitem.simpara: the header to affect.
the time to compare the content's modification time with. The content should only be transmitted if its modification time is later than t.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_get_if_modified_since()
refsect2.para: Get the time which will be compared with the content's modification time by the server to eliminate unnecessary content transfers. If this returns (time_t)-1 then there is no If-Modified-Since header.

listitem.simpara: the request to query.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_set_authorization ()
refsect2.para: Set the authorization for this request. This is like a key to get access to certain entities.
Proxy-Authorization is intended to provide access control to the proxy. Normal Authorization is passed through a proxy. See sections 14.8 for normal Authorization and 14.34.

listitem.simpara: the request to adjust the authorization for.
whether to set the Proxy-Authorization or the Authorization field.
the new authorization to use in this request.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_set_host()
refsect2.para: Set the Host: header for the HTTP request.

listitem.simpara: the HTTP Request object to affect.
the hostname as a string.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_peek_authorization ()
refsect2.para: Get the requested authorization information.

listitem.simpara: the request to query.
whether to query information about proxy authorization, or normal server authorization.
the authorization information, or NULL if none exists (default).

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_cache_directive_free ()
refsect2.para: Deallocate a EvaHttpRequestCacheDirective.

listitem.simpara: cache-directive to de-allocate.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_parse_first_line ()
refsect2.para: Parse the first line of an HTTP request.

listitem.simpara: request to initialize
first line of request header, e.g. GET / HTTP/1.0
whether the line was the start of a valid HTTP-request.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_set_cache_control ()
refsect2.para: Set the cache-control flags in the header. Note that directive will be freed by the HTTP header when it is destroyed.

listitem.simpara: the HTTP request header to affect.
the new cache control directive, stolen by the HTTP header.

refsect2.title: eva_http_request_has_content_body ()
refsect2.para: Get whether this header should be accompanied by a content-body.

listitem.simpara: the request to query.

refsect2.title: eva_http_parse_cgi_query_string ()

listitem.simpara: the full path from the HttpRequest.
the place to put the error if something goes wrong. returns: the key-value pairs of CGI data, NULL-terminated.

refsect2.title: The "host" property
refsect2.para: Hostname.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "if-modified-since" property
refsect2.para: IMS tag.
Allowed values: >= -1
Default value: -1

refsect2.title: The "max-forwards" property
refsect2.para: IMax-Forwards.
Allowed values: [-1,32]
Default value: -1

refsect2.title: The "path" property
refsect2.para: Path.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "referrer" property
refsect2.para: Referrer.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "user-agent" property
refsect2.para: User Agent.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "verb" property
refsect2.para: verb.
Default value: EVA_HTTP_VERB_GET
